reviews.text: Great restaurant with seemly real French cuisine. Their french onion soup is one of the best I have ever had. Their pasta was served cold but still had great flavor. The best part was the chocolate mouse, it was very thick and creamy, with a deep cocoa taste

Loved it...great atmosphere...had a private section and we were well taken care of. Waiters were on top of it, the food was delicious, and the bartenders were certainly mixologists. Located in a great location...parking garage near if you cant find street parking. Won't be my last time here. Definitely worth checking out.

Stopped by when we shopping in town center and had great time here! And everything was just perfect for us to rest and chat.
The food was delicious. I loved the dessert a lot.
We will be back soon.

Exquisite experience.  The food was tasty and the service top notch. We enjoyed the bread and butter, it was fresh and flaky. The entrees were all excellent. It was my first skate wing, which is a type of fish, and I was not disappointed.  The steak classified was buttery and just perfect. The creme Brule and bread pudding were the cherry on top. All in all, it was the perfect Saturday night dinner. Will be back soon to enjoy a meal with the mac and cheese (gratin). Yum

Delicious place! And perfectly positioned in the Reston Town Center. I highly recommend you go for a wonderful meal with fantastic service. The food was astounding and our waiter was very attentive.

Can't wait to host an upcoming event here!

Update.... the event happened. This team did a great job! Wonderful food, great service, and my group had a lot of fun. I highly recommend.

Cheers to happy vibes at Passion Fish happy hour! Relaxing ambiance, impeccable service, and appetizing food made our experience positive and memorable. The menu was surprisingly diverse. We liked everything on the menu. Drinks reasonably priced , beet salad was very fresh, and their bread pudding dessert with coffee paired well.  Special thanks to attentive and cheerful bartenders Alan and Steve. We will be back! 🥂

This isn't a seafood restaurant, this is a seafood palace. With two factories, a big bar (and an oyster bar), plenty of seating and impressive art, it makes for an emblematic dinner experience.

Also if you're less inclined to fancy dishes, they have some excellent happy hour with good prices. The oyster shooters and pork sliders are amazing, and bar service is pretty good. Disappointed with their margaritas though.

This was very very good. Started off with the caliente margarita which was outstanding. Then we got a couple sushi rolls to start with and they were very good too. I had the halibut entree and really enjoyed it - had very good flavor and was served over a really yummy cole slaw. Meal also came with some very nice bread rolls. Very enjoyable! We sat outside which was really nice too

The fish is awesome! Taste great. The crispy flounder definitely worth a try. It is HUGE! And the two sides were cooked differently.

The chocolate moose is awesome too, not sweet and has the bitter of dark chocolate.

We went to passion Fish to celebrate a birthday. We had made reservations, and we were seated as soon as we arrived. Our waitress Teresa was excellent. The food was great also. We ordered a dozen oysters and Ceviche for appetizer. Got couple of drinks also.
For main course we ordered Louisiana Gumbo and Salmon Sunrise Sushi and passionFish Roll . Everything was delicious.
For desert we ordered Chocolate Mousse Bomb and Florida Key Lime “Tart”. Those were delicious as well.

Order 5 entrees for the family for dinner. Disappointed with the rice being crunchy. This was the case with both white rice that comes with the entrees and the rice in the fried rice dish. I'm Chinese but not super picky about my food. Uncooked rice is one of my pet peeves.
Otherwise, food was tasty and the staff was courteous. Having the option to get Japanese and Chinese food in one place is a plus.
Staff was timely, kind, and very efficient. The food was made quickly and tasted delicious!

Wonderful experience and the nice lady that takes your order is exceptional.  Never had a bad meal from them and they are very prompt in the delivery.  I don't mind tipping them more than 18%.  Thank you Chopsticks!!!

We tried it once dine in and enjoyed it. Tried delivery and they delivered to the wrong home on the other side of the street. This house had huge numbers…no reason to miss it. They left food outside. Luckily neighbor saw it called us and asked if ordered.  Delivery ripped off receipt so he couldn’t see who ordered.  Contacted restaurant. They didn’t seem to care too much.
Eaten here several times. The staff is very friendly and service is on top of it. The food is prepared well and warm. The rolls are great.

The quality and portions of their food are good, however,  their service was very slow.
Indeed,  my wife food was totally cold ( a cold steak!) , and for my order, the pasta was cold. It seems they don't have enough servers and employees.
They have a good variety of alcoholic beverages available,  and of course, non alcoholic drinks are available as well.
The inside of the restaurant was clean, decorated well, and the servants were polite.
There are plenty of parking spots available ( outside of the restaurant)
Price? Not bad, similar to many other places,    a main course entrée starts around 16$ and goes up.
Ultimately,  if our food was not cold ( which killed the taste), I would have them at least 4 stars,
This is a management issue, though. Their staff and servers tried their best in my opinion.

Today I came to celebrate with my boyfriend, a very special moment. And he chose the best restaurant. Delicious food and on time. Each flavor is very well defined. The attention is unsurpassed, from the gentleman who took us to our table, the young man with the drinks, the food girl and of course the manager, always attentive and taking care of the details!!! It is an ideal place for all kinds of meetings, children are welcome. Ample parking. My ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ are very well won!!!!

Wow,  really disappointed with the service and food here. Arrived at 2pm, left at 4pm. Only one server in entire restaurant. Wouldn't you know it, were on the wrong side alone and was forgotten several times. The manager sat us and asked what we wanted to drink. But, never brought the drinks to us.  Sat there 18 mins before the server approaches. 30 mins to get appetizer. Another 30 mins to get salad. Had to ask for the bread. Then another 30 mins to get our entree. The food has cooled. The broccoli was cold and soggy. Wasn't with the price and time.
Not bad. I had the fettuccine carrabba, it was surprisingly tasty. The staff was very friendly and the environment was nice. The margarita did it’s job as well 😏
My experience at this location has always been great regardless of whether dining in or carrying out!  This time we dined in and our waiter was fabulous!  The good was great too!

The melting pot was a great experience! Service was amazing, our waitress was very attentive and kind. We ordered the artichoke and spinach fondue and that was delicious, maybe a tad bit too salty but tolerable. The meat entree was very yummy and I enjoyed cooking on the flat top. The bananas foster white chocolate was my favorite, very addicting ! I tried a some drinks , the berry mojito , love martini, lemon drop and the Thai drink. All were delicious except for the Thai drink would not recommend. Definitely will be coming back soon.

My bf and I had a great experience at the melting pot! Since this was our first time our server Su was super friendly and recommended what to order on the menu.

She helped us narrow down what to order and what paired well with the food we got. She checked on us multiple times to ensure my bf and I were well. Overall we had a great experience at the melting pot and would highly recommend!
One of those restaurants you go only for special occasions. I’m never disappointed. It’s amazing how quick 2hrs goes. Always friendly service and fresh ingredients. Always recommended.

We celebrated my daughter and my mom's birthday! The food was great as always! And the service was great! My kids love melting pot, and their kid menu portion is huge! Everything was so fresh!  Ying yang chocolate fondue is amazing! And my fav!!

I had never been to a Melting Pot before and was excited when a friend invited me.  Parking at this location is easy as there's a parking deck attached to the same building.  Our reservation was on time, the restaurant was clean and had a nice, slightly romantic ambience.  Our waiter was super helpful in explaining how to order and prepare our foods.  My cocktail was ok...definitely had better LOL but since we were celebrating my friend's birthday, our waiter also brought 2 complimentary glasses of champagne with dessert which was sweet and made the evening that much better.  Can't wait to go again!  Definitely worth the price for the experience.

Sara and my cocktail moved me from a 3.5 stars to 4.  The filet was pretty good and well cooked but it wasn’t as tasty as the price would indicate. The grilled shrimp was amazing. I really enjoyed it and would order it again. I got the Cadillac margarita and it was fantastic. Great flavor.

Their patio is great on a quiet weeknight.

I always enjoy eating steak when possible. I had Morton steak in Chicago, Honolulu, and many other cities. A good steak doesn't require any sauce and should be cooked to the customer's liking. This Morton Steak House truly satisfied me, and we shall be back soon.

We went there to celebrate 4 Virgo birthdays. The wait staff was wonderful! The food was pretty good. It is a little pricy, but the taste was good. We did have a few issues with our food but they appropriately resolved them.

Just a heads up…the bathrooms are beautiful but very dark.

***Not everyone is listed because no photos of people were posted without permission. If you were in our party and want me to update with your photos, just let me know. ***

I went to this place last week for my friend’s birthday dinner. I had a steak which was not cooked as requested other than that everything was ok. Amazing staff. Good quality meat , they have one of the best fries enough for two people, mashed potatoes on point. the atmosphere is nice, they’re have an outdoor seating. A bit pricey but worth it .

My family went to Morton’s for my birthday. I had a steak and lobster tail and it was pretty good. My daughter’s steak was not cooked as she requested. The waitress had to take it back twice to make it right.  Other than that, everything else was ok but not great. They gave me a free cheesecake to celebrate.

Going to chick-fil-A is the best decision. They have a variety of food, salads, hamburgers, nuggets, fries and sodas. Its staff is super nice and friendly, as is its manager. Ample parking. Fast attention and delivery of the order. Your chick-fil-A sauce is crazy, highly recommended. Its restaurant is spacious, tidy and clean. Ideal for children as well.

JENIFER WALKED PASS ME LOOKING STRAIGHT AS SHE ACT LIKE SHE DIDNT SEE ME.THE CHINESE LADY DIDNT GET A NAME SAID WHATEVER AND TOOK THE NEXT PERSON ORDER.ALL I WANTED WAS TO GET MY ORDER ILL RATHER DRIVE TO FAIRFAX…YOUR EMPLOYEES ARE RUDE..TOP TOP IT OFF I GOT CHICKEN STRIPS FOR A SANDWICH…

Another excellent lunch at Chick-fil-a!  This location like just about any other Chick-fil-a has a friendly staff, clean restaurant and great food. The food was great as always and I enjoyed a hand spun cookies and cream milkshake afterwards for an after lunch treat. This location was busy at lunch time but as always things moved smoothly and there was always a plsce to park and sit and enjoy your meal.

Oscar was beyond awesome!!!. From the second we walked in to the second we walked out. I had my infant child with me and right away he asked if I needed a sling or high chair. He also gave us a bigger bag and offered additional help since it was just me and 3 littles ones. Great customer service. Definitely recommend this location

Recently moved to Reston and have only been here twice. First time was for breakfast. Got a breakfast bowl with chicken and sausage. Paid extra for it. Came without the chicken, but it is a special request because it doesn't say you can do that on the menu so it was what it was. Just came for dinner and the line was super slow. Once you get in line you're pretty stuck and can't go anywhere. Took 25 almost 30 minutes to get through and i was maybe 6 cars back when i got in line. Which was fine it's dinner time people probably had big orders. Got my food and the sweet tea was unsweet and I was missing fries. Won't be back

Great fajitas. Quick service. Fresh tortillas. We ordered the chicken fajitas, and loved it so we ordered another one. We also ordered the barbacoa fajitas, and it was good also. This place could be a five if they get rid of the broken furniture or fix them. Going back for the fajitas, and maybe try other entrees on the menu.

So good~ could use some more seasoning, but overall still good! Loved how they gave chips and salsa just like if you were dining in…salsa had a smokiness to it and not spicy.  Staff were nice and knowledgeable.

Ok taste of food, nothing special, little bit expensive but good service by young servers!  We tried crispy tacos and bowl of rice with tortillas, didn’t like the taste much, for the price they serve, it could be lot better!!

Excellent mexican food. Tasted amazing. Would totally recommend it to everyone. The food portions are pretty sumptous, and it will leave you satisfied. Service was on point too. All in all, it's a five from me.

We ate here for my grandmother's birthday and they were able to accommodate our big family party. The service was great and we didn't have to wait long for our food to come out. We got the chocolate pinata and it was the icing on the cake, so to speak 🪅 she loved it and everyone enjoyed the fruit and churros that fell out 😂

We'll be back! Thanks for the good time!!

name: Starbucks
vicinity: One Freedom Square, 11951 Freedom Drive, Reston

reviews.text: This was the dirtiest Starbucks I’ve ever been to. The bathroom was filthy. There was barely any soap and the hand dryer didn’t work. Made you wonder how clean the employees hands were. Nothing in the store was clean. They didn’t take pride in cleanliness at all. Very disappointed!
Great service very small clean location. Don't expect long for your beverages to be made
Don't show up at "opening hours." Saturday 6:30am opening? Nope. Lights didn't come on until 6:45am; doors open at 7am.
Check your drinks before leaving.  They have been know for short you. Sometimes even pouring only half while charging you full price. This picture was taken before I took a sip after I remove the lid

This is the first time that the coffee is made just as I like, I really enjoy it. The service is awesome, they are really nice and know how to do their job; my name was misspelled and I usually don't care but she fixed right away... really nice of her! Definitely coming back!

Tasty food w/$6 mimosas (you get two drinks for the $6), bit of a confusing dining experience on your first visit though. Nice atmosphere as well as staff. Was greeted with a nice bonjour upon entry and beautiful french music while dining.

This was my first visit. It’s not a bad atmosphere and it served well as a place to sit and write. I got a lemon tart and tea. For tea they hand you a tray of bags to choose from. The tart looked lovely, but unfortunately tastes like sweetened condensed milk poured straight into an overly sweet pastry shell. In fact, I tried multiple times to discern if there might be any ingredient in the tart filling other than condensed milk, to no definite conclusion. There is probably some lemon juice mixed in, but it is faint. A couple bites was all I could do. I’d like to come back to try a meal. Perhaps they do better on other items and I’ll be able to update my review, but I suggest avoiding the tarts.

Food is just OK. I had American breakfast with a croissant but it was cold. Asked to have the croissant warm up. Quite disappointed about the croissant quality not buttery.
Quiche Lorraine was very good and delicious.
Restaurant decor was cute.
Order and pay at cashier then they will bring food to you.
Ordinary nothing special.

Finally checked out this place for brunch.  Not good as I expected but decent value for the price. You can easily find a table here on Sunday morning.

Food: The napoleon is very sweet.

I HAVE NEVER HAD COFFEEE AND PASTRIES SO GOOD! I was shocked by the quality! Whoever is baking these and prepping the pastries is doing a phenomenal job! I will be enjoying another croissant and coffee soon! The tomato basil soup is to die for!

I don't know how this place is rated so highly. Even for the cheap price point, there are many better options elsewhere. For a burger joint, I'd expect better than a frozen grade patty. My wife also ordered a chicken bacon club, but it didn't come with any bacon. The parm cheese fries we ordered came with a clump of cheese microwaved(?) on top.  Service was decent, but nothing can cover for the appalling food quality. 3/10 at least we didn't get food poisoning.

Good burgers.  My kids like these burgers over Bobby Flay’s burgers, but I prefer the latter.  Great burger over Sonoma bowl, and also they gave me a military discount. Quick and attentive servers. Sloppy paint job on the chalkboard wall though. 😅 love downtown Reston; going back again. 👍🏼👍🏼

In here you have the option to REALLY build your own burger.
Several buns, hundred sauces, and million toppings to select from. It is a really pleasant experience.

The only thing is, this fancy collection won't replace the beef patty. A perfect burger needs a perfect  patty.

The Counter used to be the place to go for a good delicious burger. However, now it is anything but that. My burger was raw, the bun of the burger fell off the plate and onto the table when the food runner brought the food and there was no apology or recognition of mistake. The service was also extremely disappointing. While I understand the struggle of staffing nowadays, our server was loudly complaining to patrons in the restaurant how she didn't want to be there since it was her "day off".

One the best burger places in the area which options to make your own. You have a large variety of cheese, toppings, patties, buns etc to choose from , which you can do while sitting at your table. You also have a menu you can order from too. As a vegetarian , I enjoyed the veggie and vegan burger.

name: On The Border Mexican Grill & Cantina - Reston

html_attributions: On The Border Mexican Grill & Cantina - Reston

reviews.text: We sat at the bar for 10 minutes before being acknowledged. The bartender cleared the previous guest's food at our spot but said nothing to us. Duri g this time, two ladies walked in and sat at the end of the bar. The bartender went around the bar to give her a hug. He then served them drinks and took their order. They clearly knew them and seemed to be giving them some sort of discount, so maybe they worked there. Not sure. But, we were full price and not important. Food was not bad. Fajitas were a small portion. Drinks were good. Will likely not go back.

Amazing food and awesome service. The only thing though we ordered combo chicken enchiladas and chicken soft taco. Instead we got  beef soft taco, our server (Jose Luis) was so nice and replaced it with chicken.  Great food, service, environment. I would definitely recommend it.

It’s been a long time since I’ve visited this place, and going there about a week ago was a good reminder why. I was in the area and decided to have lunch with a co-worker.

We arrived early afternoon and were seated promptly. Our waitress came by and took our drink orders. Took a while to figure out what to eat so I decided to opt for a new item on the menu called smokehouse fajitas which frankly wasn’t worth the price ($37.79)!

Despite the restaurant being fairly empty, it took a while to get our food. We received our meals after some time and it wasn’t what I expected. The ribs didn’t look like they were freshly made, more so pre-cooked and heated on the grill. The sausage was good (how could you go wrong?), and all else was sub-par. Received a plate with beans, rice (kind of hard/dry), with a side of sour cream, lettuce, tomato - and cheese. It’s not until after the fact I noticed I should have gotten tortillas with my meal considering it was a fajita plate. Right? I didn’t mention anything once the waitress came around because frankly I was okay with reducing my caloric intake (the meal indicates it’s 2,000+ calories!)

Needless to say, I didn’t finish the meal. Ate the sausage, the 3 ribs or so, a bit of the lettuce/guac and asked for the check. The total for 2 people was around $60 (not including the additional 20% tip). I’m sure there are other meals that are probably better and more reasonably priced but due to my unimpressive experience I likely won’t be going back.

Stopped in for lunch and started with a beer.now this is a bud light and came with a lot of head. The  manager is sitting behind me and did nothing. It was also the only beer I order because of that.

Now the steak I received was good and cooked as requested. But the rice was old and dry, definitely not fresh, which is surprising because I arrive when they opened.

The bean weren’t much better.
They have good food (especially the queso!), good drinks, and we received great service. They have a private room in the back for parties and some out seating.

One day I was craving kabobs, and I opened Doordash to see what was around me. I ended up choosing Reston Kabob since my co-workers mentioned they were great for lunch.

I ordered the veggie samosa and the ground beef platter (Beef kobeeda). The Veggie samosa was nice and crispy, and the inside was very fluffy. The Beef kobeeda was also good when combined with the white and green sauce. The salad and chick peas however were subpar at best. The salad felt like it was straight out of a bag, and the chick peas weren't very flavorful.

Overall, getting Reston Kabob was a great choice for lunch. It was nice and filling. I highly recommend the Veggie Samosa since that was a great addition to the overall meal.

We’ve been to this kebab place multiple times, and we’ve loved it every time. The gyro platter is awesome and we both loved the grilled chicken kebabs. They meticulously cook them over the grill, so the chicken comes out perfectly each time. They also make their own flatbread, and cook it on the inside of a round oven/cooker—phenomenal!! Finally, they have a couple of different sauces on the table, with the green being a bit tangy/Spicy and the white being more creamy with spices (reminds us of Alabama white BBQ sauce). The restaurant cooks your food fresh, so it takes a few minutes, but it’s well worth the wait. Recommend you try it, we’ll definitely be back!!

Don’t waste your money!!
This is  ridiculous how ugly they make food and even they don’t have any idea about  how food should looks like. One squares kabob comes with a little rice, salad and chickpeas!! Awful look food kababs are broken in few pieces. Here my 4 combo looks like after a lot of arguments!!! Awful!! I wouldn’t buy it if I didn’t have to. They have to go one time eat kabab at Shamshiri or Alborz to understand how their food should look like. Beside than that a man who I think was the owner has a ridiculous manner very impolite!! That rudeness upset me more than food. Like I said Don’t waste your money just look at these kabobs, rice!! And even they didn’t give dressing for salad.

Excellent food quality-tender meat and juicy-generous portions.  I was amazed with the food quality and presentation.  The place mainly does lots of take outs and few sit downs even though option is there (self serve).  I would go back for the quality.

Don’t waste your money!!
This's ridiculous, not fresh not well cooked, terrible taste, I will never ordered it again, I don't recommend that restaurant
A cramped little space with no seating and problematic parking. My hash browns tasted funny but at least I don't think I got all six of them. The sandwich wasn't horrible.
Small space and no drive thru but staff was very friendly and fast. Order was correct and egg bagel and hash browns were warm and tasty.
Needed something to take the grr out of my tummy. A breakfast wrap and a donut with a small bottle of Simply OJ really hit the spot, even in the middle of the afternoon.
Fantastic team. My coffee is always ready on time, just how I like it.

My friend ordered a butter beer bc he thought he was at Hogwarts (they didn’t have it). Needless to say he’ll never be returning to this institution again. My iced coffee was delish! I’ll be back tomorrow
Great burgers with a ton of toppings for a decent price. They also make the burgers pretty quick even when it's busy. Fries are delicious as well. They fill the bag so a small is plenty for me

I ordered a little cheeseburger with ketchup, Mayonnaise and extra pickles. I GOT a cheeseburger with lettuce, tomato, oninos!!!🤮onions!!! And mushrooms!!! I spent a $22 dollars with only a regular fry to show for it!!! Funny,  sign on the wall,  which I should have taken a picture of,  said Voted Best $5 Burger. 😕. Needless to say I will not be back.

The employees here are very polite and efficient. This Five Guys is very clean. I ordered the little bacon cheeseburger, little fries and a drink. The fries are amazing!! If you are not hungry enough to get a meal, order the fries... And don't forget to bring a few dollars and tip these hard working friendly employees!! 😁

Getting hamburgers here is a rare treat.  My husband and I usually get the small (one patty) burgers with all the fixings plus Cajun fries plus peanuts.  The flavors are tasty and never under it overcooked.  And when we order 1 small cajun fries, we get the extra fries (that comes with the service), and that's enough for us both. and for some odd reason our weight goes down the next day,  maybe because we're so full we don't snack afterwards...definitely a welcomed and unexpected outcome.

The least favorite Five Guys location. Burger were lower quality, not much but still noticeable. On top of that, No milkshake on the menu. Staff were attentive but not as friendly as other location I have visited.

My partner and I placed and online order for this location. When we arrived, they said that they had no order placed from us. We tried to show proof from our bank account that shows money taken from our account for a subway purchase but they just kept repeating sorry. Why do both of the subway locations close to me absolutely suck!

First,  they are closed on Sunday,  I m not sure about Saturday. Also, as far as I see, they are closed after PM.
The location is not very good, mostly seems for people who are working around that area.
So if you want to go there, it is located after a roundabout, you should park in a nearby parking garage (almost behind Subway) , or a little bit far in a open space.
The parking garage has some limitations,  mostly reserved spaces for the business.
By the way, their inside seats are not enough, but you can sit outside, there are many benches available in almost middle area of the roundabout.
Their service is  ok, a little lower than most  Subway in other places.

Will stop going here the big Spanish girl has such a bad attitude and acts like the toppings are coming out of her check. When i asked for extra sause she put one quick squirt and wrapped sandwich. Horrible service

This is so freaking place..!! The lady who was there in the noon time on (07/27/2017 at 2:30 pm) was so rude and arrogant, she simply put all unwanted stuff on my sub without me asking when I said I dint ask for that stuff she started explaining things saying this is this n bla bla bla..!! As if I dint know..!! No manners at all..!! Over all a worst experience.
Usually a good place, I go regularly. But this time they are different persons and it sucked. They seemed as if I was begging for food

My boyfriend and I love this place. It is the best Popeyes we’ve ever been to and we’ll continue going to this one for as long as we’re here.

Outstanding customer service, never had a rude employee there, they are generous with their fries, and the store is always squeaky clean (which is impressive for a greasy place like Popeyes).

Try the Blackened Ranch sauce here. You will not regret it.

The manager is awesome. Didn’t get her name but shout out to great service.

There at around 7pm and had 3 people in front of me. There were only 3 workers behind the counter and hustling as fast as they could to take orders, prep and pack the food. They could really use some more help. Only ordered chicken which was well prepared.

The crew here is very busy and some patrons get annoyed at them, but really, any error is understandable in context, and they always correct immediately. They might not be smiling, but you try working 10-hour days with one half-hour break in sweltering kitchen heat, standing on hard floors. The food is consistently good, very like the pictures on the menu, flavorful, and plentiful for the price. And, more than once, a complaint I had was speedily and helpfully addressed.
I feel that Popeyes has stepped it up a notch! The food is better, the locations are cleaner and more modern.  If you gill out a questionnaire online you get a free meal. Give it a try!

I always had a good experience here until for this past Monday. I am very disturbed that I found a long piece of hair in the mac and cheese. This is why wearing hair nets are important. I wont be going back anymore.

I mean it is what it is. I’m sure the food comes out different every time but something bout my food today is just extra seasoned.

A little to salty and the seasoning is to over powering it’s almost not enjoyable. The spicy ness has more of a kick than usual. I got a salad and the dressing could be adding more saltiness but I hadn’t even poured it on when I took my first bite.

Solid Chipotle in Reston serving their typical menu. This is a much smaller facility than other Chipotles I've visited, they cater more to go the "to-go" crowd but there are a few tables available if you prefer to eat on-site.

The store looks very clean, the staff speaks English and also Spanish.  The dine in is open and to use the bathroom they give you a code.  Next to the store there is a garden with lights where you can take very beautiful photos.  The product was fresh but I hardly noticed that they put chicken and meat on us.  It seems that they are putting less quantity today since rice was abundant in the food.

I went two weeks ago to this chipotle and was a really bad experience. It was 10am, and I was happily surprise that it was open since other chipotle locations usually open at 11. Well, the staff was not prepared, it took them like 5mins to take my order and it was 4 employees in front of me , and no other costumers in the line. I understand there is construction going on in the area, but the floor was dirty and with trash. My food wasn't fresh. I confirmed when I saw the apparently manager taking picture of the of he cook line (took picture of each tray), and I saw him getting into the stale/brown guacamole, and instead of taking the bad guac on the top,  he started to move it and mixed with the guac from the bottom to be able to take a good picture. I ordered a kids quesadilla,  and I was asked if I wanted rice and beans with it, and said yes "black beans and rice" , and the beans were spicy, I told one of the employees and she was rude and said "yes, the beans are spicy " , why I was offered an spicy item for a kids meal in the first place if that was the case. I will never coming back. Dont waste your money in this location.
Im not sure if it was because I was hungry but this was one of the best tasting Chipotle. Service was good too!

Absolutely delicious salad spot! Tons of unique options with lots of flavor. The Buffalo chicken bowl is our favorite and adding spicy broccoli is a must! Elote bowl and Buffalo chicken pictured. Both run about $12.45 currently with add ins being about $.50 each.

So glad my wife and I came here! This place was so tasty! Don't think this is just a glorified salad place. This is what salad should taste like! So much flavor great choices and great atmosphere! 5 stars baby!

This place is basically a joke. I ordered a salad (custom). It came up to 20$! And this is white I get. 20$ for lettuce basically. Quantity and presentation are ridiculous. Also got a piece of bread that was more like a piece rubber. Goes a few days back. Disappointing and disgusting.

Sweet Green is a proper Salad Place, I loved the salad over here, I bought Greek Goddess and Guacamole bowl, they have all the greens setup one side and all the veggies and meat aside. You pick and choose what greens and veggies you need. It’s kinda chipotle style, I loved the taste . It’s fresh. They also have kombucha and few varieties of drinks. Its affordable and tasty.

Being located in the Reston town center area, means, everything is usually overpriced,  but the Sweetgreen is one of the overpriced captains for sure.
A bowl of salad ( Kale & Ceasar) cost me more than 12$ which does not include any tips, drinks, or adding extra topping or items.
I put a typical cup beside the bowl for the scale purpose. I was not starting to eat at the time I had taken the photo. So you can see the size of the food and what was there.
Plenty of lettuce and kale,   a few small chickens,  and a few tomatoes with a small bread. That was more than 12$!
Quality? With this price, the average.
Taste? Good.
Employees? Polite,
Service? Fast ,  noon time, the only big positive point.

I was in the area and went there on the first day for dinner. The owner Lisa was a delight, such a sweet soul, we chatted for a few and she recommended the Okoy as appetizer and I ordered the curry chicken as my entree. Both were amazing and the portions were huge. Before leaving, Lisa made me a cup of tea to go as the temperature started to drop. I went back the next day for lunch and the food was even better than the day before. I ordered Cuban Flan as dessert and I couldn't tell if I was in Miami or Virginia for so good it was. I will definitely go back when i am in the area!
I ordered food to go via Doordash. The food was very good and seasoned nicely. My only con is the pricing for such a small order. I am from Hampton Roads area so I do take that into consideration.

This one is really a hidden gem: if you love authentic Islander and Asian food in general, and Filipino food in particular, look no further. The dishes are carefully prepared, beautifully presented, and always satisfying. The chef herself is Filipino, and cooks many traditional recipes. I have several friends from the Philippines who have eaten here regularly because it reminds them of home. 💙

Couple that with the quiet, evening dining atmosphere and the friendly service, this one is well worth a visit.
The food was delicious and our server was so kind and made sure that the food was vegetarian for my husband.  We really enjoyed the whole experience.  I can't wait to return to try the lumpia!

My family and I have been eating from here for about 20 years.  For a bit we thought that it was gone but rediscovered it last week.  Great food of all kinds in a little place tucked back in an office park.
